cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles NW of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW across the Turks & Caicos and Bahamas, forecast to turn northwest toward the Florida Peninsula and then curve north-northwest into Georgia/South Carolina

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through the Carolinas is within the day-4/5 cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are currently a 51% cumulative risk, with a 25% chance of sustained 50-kt winds by Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Given the forecast northward track just inland from the SC coast, on-shore flow could produce 3–6 ft of surge in and around Charleston Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts as the core passes inland to the west of the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous rip currents, possible tornadoes embedded in outer rain bands, and likely port closure/operations halt beginning late Sunday.
